summary: hey so what happened with that article you mentioned I'm from the UK and it doesn't grant access to EU citizens  could you...
question: hey so what happened with that article you mentioned I'm from the UK and it doesn't grant access to EU citizens  could you please put up screenshots I don't have a Tumblr or social media btw but please at least tell me what it said I'm so confused rn
answer:
It was an article posted by Salt Lake Tribune and it was pretty spoiler heavy regarding the plot for One in a Minyan. So if you wanna read it, you’ve been warned! (I literally just copied and pasted the whole article so if there are mistakes I’m sorry lol) 

In the 2½ seasons “Andi Mack” has been on the air, it has dealt with family secrets, bullying, guns, love, betrayal, multiculturalism, religion, sexism, privacy, lies, military deployments, standing up to authority, jealousy, mental health and more than a little teenage angst.

This week’s episode (Friday, 6 p.m., Disney Channel) of the made-in-Utah show deals with death. And it’s funny. Really.

Cyrus (Joshua Rush) is mourning the loss of his grandmother. He and his family are sitting shiva, the weeklong mourning period that’s unfamiliar to Cyrus’ non-Jewish friends.

But, supportive friends that they are, Andi (Peyton Elizabeth Lee), Buffy (Sofia Wylie) and Jonah (Asher Angel) are there for Cyrus.

Jonah — unaware that Jewish custom is to have the burial as quickly as possible — asks to see the body of Cyrus’ bubbe to pay his respects. He’s surprised when he learns she’s already been buried.

“She’s not laid out somewhere?” he asks.

“This is a shiva,” Cyrus says. “The only thing that gets laid out are the deli platters.”

There are a lot of jokes like that in the episode, written by Jonathan Hurwitz. There’s a plot line in which Cyrus’ relatives are shocked and dismayed that Andi’s father, Bowie (Trent Garrett), has brought a kugel (a noodle casserole) devoid of raisins to the shiva.

Later in the episode, Cyrus tells his friends, “You know the story behind every major Jewish holiday — they tried to kill us. We survived. Let’s eat!”

You don’t often see religious traditions portrayed like this. And it’s more rare still to see Jewish traditions play such a central, sympathetic role.

“Shiva’s about friends and family being together to comfort one another and share stories,” Cyrus says.

“That sounds like a really nice thing to do when you’ve just lost someone,” Andi says.

“It is,” Cyrus replies. “Except … it lasts seven days. We take a long time to say goodbye.”

This being “Andi Mack,” that’s not the only thing going on. Andi and her grandmother Celia (Lauren Tom) are at odds over details of Andi’s parents’ upcoming wedding. Jonah has another panic attack — a strong storyline that lets young viewers know that we all deal with issues.

Speaking of modeling good behavior, Cyrus finally comes out to Jonah, a development that’s not a big deal — which makes a statement by not being a Major Event.

I know I’m repeating myself, but “Andi Mack” is an exceptional series that kids can learn a lot from while they’re being entertained. And, unlike so many shows aimed at kids and tweens, this one is watchable for parents and grandparents, too.

The question hanging over the show is not answered in this episode, however. There’s been no mention of Andi’s grandfather Ham since the actor who plays him, Stoney Westmoreland, was arrested in Salt Lake City on charges he tried to set up a sexual encounter with a person he believed to be a 13-year-old boy.

To repeat myself again, Westmoreland was not a regular on “Andi Mack.” He was a supporting character when he did appear. And kids who don’t know what happened wouldn’t have noticed his absence in the four new episodes that have aired since he was arrested and fired.

But, assuming Bowie and Bex (Lilan Bowden) actually do get married, it will be tough to have the wedding without somehow explaining how the father of the bride isn’t there.
answer_abstract: It was an article posted by Salt Lake Tribune and it was pretty spoiler heavy regarding the plot for One in a Minyan. So if you wanna read it, you’ve been warned! (I literally just copied and pasted the whole article so if there are mistakes I’m sorry lol)

summary: who is your fav am character and why??
question: who is your fav am character and why??
answer: Cyrus. I can relate to his awkwardness and his attempts to fit in, as well as trying to be there for his friends. I feel like me and him would get along well because of our similarities. Also, we both like dumb white boys who look like bread sticks.

tags: but maaaan if it happens i would die happy
im a SUCKER for parallels and callbacks
and that one would speak volumes
summary: im sad because i know we wont get  parallel of when jonah and cyrus got matching jackets, to tj and cyrus getting matching...
question: im sad because i know we wont get  parallel of when jonah and cyrus got matching jackets, to tj and cyrus getting matching something and wearing them together (unlike how jonah wanted to) like that would've been so cute man
answer:
Mood. But like at the same time you never know with this show…

On one VERY BIG hand I’m not getting my hopes up to see that as a parallel because I hate getting my hopes up especially since there’s a low probability. On the other hand a part of me is optimistically hopeful since we got lucky and they deadass gave us a swings 2.0 scene so I mean.. yOU NEVER KNOW. Terri and her parallels hmm…?

Plus there’s always fanart and fanfic to fill that void!! I’m just looking forward to like ANY parallels that’ll come about, especially in the carnival episode. Hopefully.

blog.name: tj-meets-cyrus
blog.title: Andi Mack
blog.description: Laura ☆ 22 ☆ side blog ☆ icon by @admirablyamber ☆ main: mystery-hack

summary: I'm curious how they're going to introduce the storyline of Cyrus' grandma passing. Like, are they going to jump right into...
body: I’m curious how they’re going to introduce the storyline of Cyrus’ grandma passing. Like, are they going to jump right into Cyrus and his family sitting Shiva? Or will the opening scene involve Cyrus finding out the news himself - maybe his parents sit him down and tell him? Although that would be a strange juxtaposition with the theme song immediately following. Or maybe it’ll just start with Andi, Bex, and Bowie getting dressed up to head over to Cyrus’ house, and they’re the ones that break the news to the audience.

summary: Thank you so much for recommending Billy Maier, I’m obsessed w his reactions now! Do you have any idea of his upload...
question: Thank you so much for recommending Billy Maier, I’m obsessed w his reactions now! Do you have any idea of his upload schedule/how often he uploads?
answer: I’m not sure if he has a strict schedule, but for the past 2-ish weeks he’s been posting an Andi Mack reaction almost daily. He also reacts to a bunch of other series though, so he may sometime take breaks from one show to focus on another, I’m not sure.

summary: JONAH OR TJ??????
question: JONAH OR TJ??????
answer: My man, T.J. No offense but up until like two episodes ago, Jonah was just an oblivious white bread stick, he’s finally evolving into a nice loaf of bread now after three seasons.

blog.name: disneymack
blog.title: andi mack trash
blog.description:

main blog & twitter: sadieannerue instagram: dailymackcast, andimackpapercraneproject

tags: this is a weird thing to say ngl
summary: I cannot wait until josh turns 18 and you can stop playing the “He is a CHILD” card whenever it applies. I’m sure even he...
question: I cannot wait until josh turns 18 and you can stop playing the “He is a CHILD” card whenever it applies. I’m sure even he doesn’t necessarily want to be referred to as a child.
answer:
No offence, but when have I ever “played” this as a “card”.

I refer to him as like “my precious child/son” or “kiddo” but those are terms of endearment, and quite obviously joking. Hell, I still call Taylor Swift my child too because I watched her grow up, and she is 6 years older than me. I have also made it very clear that if Josh ever showed any discomfort or offence in fans using those kinds of terms for him, I would stop immediately.

I actually try very hard not to patronize Josh - because I have an incredible amount of respect for him as a human being. He is perfectly capable of taking care of himself and doing what is best for him, and even when I come to his defense for whatever reason - I usually try to point this out. He is wise well beyond his years and a completely capable young man.

When I do have to talk about protecting or defending him, it is usually in reference to something pretty big. I felt the need to do so a lot following Westmoreland’s arrest, because I didn’t want people sending him questions about it and I didn’t want the media associating his name/face to the story. Since then the only reasons I have really had to “play” any “cards” would be when Josh is being harassed online, and when it got to the point where he felt the need to leave his blog. 

In both of those situations - I believe that the overall messages I was trying to convey when talking about it were much more important than the terms I used to describe Josh himself. But with that being said - I am almost positive that in talking about those things - I definitely used the terms underage, minor, and teenager to refer to him because they are more accurate and more professional. I also made a post when he left his blog explaining that the fact that he is a minor wasn’t the reason I was upset or defending him - but rather the fact that a human being was being treated so poorly for no valid reason. I was actually really annoyed that day because a lot of people were making posts about how it’s unfair to treat a 17 year old like that, but I was more upset that ANYONE could be treated like that.

If you are referring to me saying “protect our children”, that is mostly a joke and it pre-dates Andi Mack. It is not at all meant to describe Josh in particular, but rather the child actors and public figures who are regularly and unfairly mistreated by people my age and older. I first started saying it about Zendaya and Bella Thorne (who are literally only 1-2 years younger than me) on Shake It Up! because everyone my age hated that show, and took it out on them and I saw it as something really disgusting. When I have used it on this blog, it mostly started out to describe the cast as a whole, not just Josh. But I used that term before I ever made that blog as kind of a joke towards the fact that I get a genuine motherly urge to protect and defend young people who are being harassed or mistreated… which is kind of an urge we should all feel so like… I definitely don’t feel bad about it. 

I also find it weird that this is something you cannot wait for. Like is it really that big of a deal to you? Because if you you could kind of just… unfollow me? I don’t understand the point of interacting with blogs if their content annoys or bothers you.
